name: Absorb
battleEffect: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by up to half the damage taken by the target.
secondaryEffect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

name: Acid Armor
battleEffect: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply boosting its Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense two stages.

name: Acid Spray
battleEffect: The user attacks by spitting fluid that works to melt the target. This also harshly lowers the target's Sp. Def stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Special Defense two stages.

name: Acrobatics

secondaryEffect: Increases damage by 100% if user is not holding an item.

name: Acupressure
battleEffect: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies' stats.
secondaryEffect: Raises one of the user's stats randomly by two stages.

name: Aerial Ace
battleEffect: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

name: After You
battleEffect: The user helps the target and makes it use its name right after the user.
secondaryEffect: Target names immediately after the user

name: Agility
battleEffect: The user relaxes and lightens its body to name faster. This sharply boosts its Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Speed two stages.

name: Air Cutter
battleEffect: The user launches razor-like wind to slash opposing Pokémon. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Air Slash

secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Ally Switch

secondaryEffect: Switches place with other Pokémon on field

name: Amnesia

secondaryEffect: Raises user's Special Defense two stages.

name: Ancient Power

secondaryEffect: May raise all user's stats one stage.

name: Aqua Cutter

secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Aqua Jet
battleEffect: The user lunges at the target to inflict damage, moving at blinding speed. This name always goes first.
secondaryEffect: Has increased Speed Priority

name: Aqua Step
battleEffect: The user toys with the target and attacks it using light and fluid dance steps. This also boosts the user's Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Speed one stage.

name: Aqua Tail

secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Arm Thrust
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with open-palmed arm thrusts. This name hits two to five times in a row.
secondaryEffect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

name: Armor Cannon
battleEffect: The user shoots its own armor out as blazing projectiles. This also lowers the user's Defense and Sp. Def stats.
secondaryEffect: Lowers user's Defense & Special Defense stats by one stage.

name: Assurance

secondaryEffect: Doubles damage if target has already received damage this turn.

name: Astonish

secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Aura Sphere
battleEffect: The user lets loose a pulse of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

name: Aurora Veil
battleEffect: This name reduces damage from physical and special names for five turns. This can be used only when it is snowing.
secondaryEffect: This name will put up a protective barrier that will reduce the damage inflicted by attacks by 50% in Single Battles, and 33% in Double Battles. It can run in conjunction with Reflect and Light Screen but does not stack. It can only be activated during Hail, but will continue if Hail ends during its time. The ability Infiltrator ignores its effects

name: Avalanche
battleEffect: This name's power is doubled if the target has inflicted damage on the user in the same turn.
secondaryEffect: Power doubles if user was hit before using the Attack.

name: Axe Kick
battleEffect: The user attacks by kicking up into the air and slamming its heel down upon the target. This may also confuse the target. If it misses, the user takes damage instead.
secondaryEffect: May confuse the opponent. If the name misses, the user takes 25% damage

name: Baby-Doll Eyes
battleEffect: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes, which lowers the target's Attack stat. This name always goes first.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack stat one stage

name: Baton Pass
battleEffect: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.
secondaryEffect: Switches out the user but stat changes remain.

name: Beat Up
battleEffect: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the greater the number of attacks.
secondaryEffect: Does additional damage for every Pokémon in trainer's team.

name: Belch
battleEffect: The user lets out a damaging belch at the target. The user must eat a held Berry to use this name.
secondaryEffect: Consumes a Berry

name: Belly Drum
battleEffect: The user maximizes its Attack stat but loses HP equal to half its max HP.
secondaryEffect: Cut's half of user's maximum HP and maximizes Attack.

name: Bite
battleEffect: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Bitter Blade
battleEffect: The user focuses its bitter feelings toward the world of the living into a slashing attack. The user's HP is restored by up to half the damage taken by the target.
secondaryEffect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

name: Blast Burn
battleEffect: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can't name on the next turn.
secondaryEffect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

name: Blizzard

secondaryEffect: May Freeze opponent.

name: Block
battleEffect: The user blocks the target's way with arms spread wide to prevent the target from fleeing.
secondaryEffect: Prevents the opponent from escaping.

name: Body Press
battleEffect: The user attacks by slamming its body into the target. The higher the user's Defense stat, the greater the damage this name deals.
secondaryEffect: Users the user's Defense stat in damage calculation rather than Attack stat

name: Body Slam
battleEffect: The user attacks by dropping onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Boomburst
battleEffect: The user attacks everything around it with the destructive power of a terrible explosive sound.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Bounce
battleEffect: The user bounces up high on the first turn, then drops onto the target on the next turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn. May induce Paralysis

name: Brave Bird
battleEffect: The user tucks in its wings and charges at a low altitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.
secondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to a third of the damage inflicted.

name: Breaking Swipe
battleEffect: The user swings its tough tail wildly and attacks opposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Attack stats.
secondaryEffect: Lowers all opponent's Attack one stage

name: Brick Break
battleEffect: The user attacks with a swift chop. This name can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
secondaryEffect: This name will rename any Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil or that is in play on the opponent's team.

name: Brutal Swing
battleEffect: The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Bug Bite
battleEffect: The user attacks by biting the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
secondaryEffect: Renames target's Berry and uses its effect

name: Bug Buzz
battleEffect: The user vibrates to generate a damaging sound wave. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

name: Bulk Up
battleEffect: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, boosting its Attack and Defense stats.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack and Defense one stage.

name: Bulldoze

secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Speed one stage.

name: Bullet Seed
battleEffect: The user attacks by forcefully shooting seeds at the target. This name hits two to five times in a row.
secondaryEffect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

name: Calm Mind
battleEffect: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to boost its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Special Attack and Special Defense one stage.

name: Charge

secondaryEffect: Boosts power of user's next Electric-type Attack by 100%. Increases user's Special Defense by 1 stage

name: Charge Beam
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with an electric charge. The residual electricity may also boost the user's Sp. Atk stat.
secondaryEffect: May raise user's Special Attack one stage

name: Charm

secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack two stages.

name: Chilling Water

secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack one stage.

name: Circle Throw

secondaryEffect: Forces opponent to switch Pokémon.

name: Clear Smog
battleEffect: The user attacks the target by throwing a clump of special mud. All stat changes are eliminated.
secondaryEffect: Renames all stat changes

secondaryEffect: Lowers user's Defense & Special Defense stats by one stage.

secondaryEffect: Raises Attack, Defense & Accuracy one stage.

battleEffect: The user transforms and crashes to the ground, causing a massive prehistoric explosion. This name's power is boosted more than usual if it's a supereffective hit.
secondaryEffect: Boosts damage by 50% if the name is Super Effective on the target

name: Comeuppance
battleEffect: The user retaliates with much greater force against the opponent that last inflicted damage on it.
secondaryEffect: Damages the last Pokémon to hit the user with 150% of the damage inflicted on the user

name: Confuse Ray
battleEffect: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that causes confusion.
secondaryEffect: Induces Confusion

name: Confusion

secondaryEffect: May induce Confusion

name: Copycat

secondaryEffect: Uses the name used just before it in battle.

name: Cosmic Power
battleEffect: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to boost its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense and Special Defense one stage.

name: Counter

secondaryEffect: If hit by a physical Attack, deals double the damage received.

name: Covet
battleEffect: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target's held item.
secondaryEffect: May steal opponent's item (temporarily in trainer battles).

name: Crabhammer
battleEffect: The target is hammered with a large pincer. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Cross Chop

secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

secondaryEffect: Has high critical hit ratio. May induce poison.

name: Crunch

secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

name: Curse

secondaryEffect: Ghost type Pokémon: User loses half their maximum HP, and the opponent gets a Nightmare. Other Pokémon types: Raises user's Attack and Defense one stage. Lowers user's Speed one stage.

name: Dark Pulse
battleEffect: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with ill intent. This may also make the target flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Dazzling Gleam
battleEffect: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Defense Curl
battleEffect: The user curls up and boosts its Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense one stage. Damage from Rollout & Ice Ball is doubled.

name: Destiny Bond
battleEffect: If the user is knocked out after using this name, the Pokémon that knocked it out will also faint. This name's chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
secondaryEffect: If the user faints, the opponent will also faint. Will fail on successive uses.

name: Detect
battleEffect: This name enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
secondaryEffect: If used in succession with other protection names, its success rate is cut to 33% of what it was, working cumulatively the more it's used. This will prevent damage and effects of almost all possible attacks that would be inflicted upon the user.There are a few names and abilities which do break through this name The following names are also unaffected by Protect & Detect: Doom Desire (delayed damage only), Future Sight (delayed damage only), Feint, Hyperspace Fury, Hyperspace Hole, Imprison, Perish Song, Phantom Force, Psych Up, Shadow Force, Transform

name: Dig
battleEffect: The user burrows into the ground on the first turn, then attacks on the next turn.
secondaryEffect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn.

name: Disable
battleEffect: For four turns, the target will be unable to use whichever name it last used.
secondaryEffect: Disables opponent's last name.

name: Disarming Voice
battleEffect: Letting out a charming cry, the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Never Misses.

name: Discharge

secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Dive

secondaryEffect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn.

name: Doodle

secondaryEffect: Changes the Abilities of all your Pokémon on the field to that of the targetted Pokémon

name: Double Hit
battleEffect: The user slams the target with a tail or the like. The target is hit twice in a row.
secondaryEffect: Attacks twice in a row.

name: Double Kick
battleEffect: The user attacks by kicking the target twice in a row using two feet.
secondaryEffect: Attacks twice in a row.

secondaryEffect: Renames Electric-type from user. If user was pure Electric-type, it is now without a type.

name: Double Team

secondaryEffect: Raises user's Evasion one stage.

name: Double-Edge

secondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to a third of the damage inflicted.

secondaryEffect: Lowers user's Special Attack two stages.

name: Dragon Breath

secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Dragon Claw
battleEffect: The user slashes the target with huge, sharp claws to inflict damage.

name: Dragon Dance

secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Dragon Rush

secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Dragon Tail
battleEffect: The target is knocked away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
secondaryEffect: Forces opponent to switch Pokémon.

battleEffect: The user attacks with an energy-draining punch. The user's HP is restored by up to half the damage taken by the target.
secondaryEffect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

name: Draining Kiss
battleEffect: The user steals the target's HP with a kiss. The user's HP is restored by over half the damage taken by the target.
secondaryEffect: User recovers 75% the damage inflicted.

name: Drill Peck
battleEffect: A corkscrewing attack that strikes the target with a sharp beak acting as a drill.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Drill Run
battleEffect: The user crashes into the target while rotating its body like a drill. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Dual Wingbeat
battleEffect: The user slams the target with its wings to inflict damage. The target is hit twice in a row.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Earth Power

secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

name: Earthquake
battleEffect: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.
secondaryEffect: If used against an opponent that is using Dig, the damage inflicted will be doubled

name: Echoed Voice
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this name is used consecutively by any Pokémon, its power is boosted.
secondaryEffect: This name increases in power when used by y Pokémon on your side in the last turn. The increase is by 100%. If two Pokémon use it in Double or Triple Battles or it's used repeatedly, the second power is 80 and if a third Pokémon uses it, its Base Power is 160. If it's used a fourth time within the same two turns, it is capped at 200.

name: Eerie Impulse
battleEffect: The user's body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack two stages.

name: Electric Terrain
battleEffect: The user turns the ground into Electric Terrain for five turns, powering up Electric-type names. Pokémon on the ground can no longer fall asleep.
secondaryEffect: This name creates a terrain that helps Pokémon on the ground for 5 turns. It prevents the Pokémon from sleep and boosts the power of Electric-type names on grounded Pokémon by 30%

name: Electro Ball
battleEffect: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target, the greater the name's power.
secondaryEffect: Electro Ball is unique in that its power is determined based upon both the user's speed and the speed of the target. More damage is inflicted if the opponent is slower than the user. This isn't done via a specific calculation but has set amounts based upon the speed values.SpeedBase PowerTarget Speed > 50% of User60Target Speed > 33% of User80Target Speed > 25% of User120Target Speed < 25% of User150

name: Electro Drift
battleEffect: The user races forward at ultrafast speeds, piercing its target with futuristic electricity. This name's power is boosted more than usual if it's a supereffective hit.
secondaryEffect: Boosts damage by 50% if the name is Super Effective on the target

name: Ember
battleEffect: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.
secondaryEffect: May induce burn.

name: Encore
battleEffect: The user compels the target to keep using the name it encored for three turns.
secondaryEffect: This name causes the target to use their last used name for their next three turns. It will fail if the target's name failed, it hasn't used a name since being sent out, or if the last name they used has 0PP. It will also fail if the target used Encore, Mimic, Mirror name, Sketch, Struggle or Transform in their last turn.

name: Endeavor
battleEffect: The user inflicts damage by cutting down the target's HP to roughly equal the user's HP.
secondaryEffect: Reduces the target's Hit Points to match the current Hit Points of the user.

name: Endure
battleEffect: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. This name's chance of failing rises if used in succession.
secondaryEffect: If used in succession with other protection names, it has a 50% reduction in its success rate. Endure runs differently to the other names. It doesn't prevent damage from attacks, but rather it prevents the Pokémon from fainting.When Endure is used and is successful, it will prevent the user from being knocked out by leaving the user with 1 Hit Point. This lasts the entire turn so it can receive multiple hits which end up doing no damage. This can be used with multiple strategies and names including Reversal so that you can get your Hit Points down safely and then do massive damageSeveral items and abilities work in a similar manner to Endure; Sturdy leaves the user with 1 Hit Point if the user was to be knocked out when having full Hit Points. In a similar manner, the item Focus Sash works in an identical way. However, the other item; Focus Band will work regardless of Hit Points as it has a 10% chance of allowing the user to hold on from a name which would knock it out. Like the previous item, it'll leave it at 1 Hit Point.

name: Energy Ball
battleEffect: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

name: Entrainment

secondaryEffect: This name changes the opponent's abiliy to that of the user of this name. Doesn't work against Pokémon with the Truant, Zen Mode or Multitype abilities.

name: Extrasensory
battleEffect: The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power. This may also make the target flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Facade

secondaryEffect: May BURN opponent or cause opponent to flinch.

name: Fire Pledge
battleEffect: A column of fire hits the target. When used with its grass counterpart, this name's power is boosted and a vast sea of fire appears.
secondaryEffect:
This name, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Water Pledge, will create a rainbow which doubles the changes of names having Seconday Effects for four turns. The power is increased to 150
This name, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Grass Pledge, will damage the opponents by 1/8th of their total Hit Points for four turns. If the opponents are of the Fire-Type, they don't receive damage.  The power is increased to 150

name: Fire Punch
battleEffect: The target is attacked with a fiery punch. This may also leave the target with a burn.
secondaryEffect: May induce burn.

name: Fire Spin

name: Focus Energy

secondaryEffect: Increases user's critical hit rate.

This name, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Water Pledge, will create a marsh which reduces the speed of all opponents by 75% for four turns.  The power is increased to 150
This name, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Fire Pledge, will damage the opponents by 1/8th of their total Hit Points for four turns. If the opponents are of the Fire-Type, they don't receive damage.  The power is increased to 150

name: Gyro Ball
battleEffect: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user is than the target, the greater the name's power.
secondaryEffect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 150 making it a very powerful attack to be used. However, this is completely dependant on your Pokémon's Speed as well as the Speed of your target. First, the user & targets speeds are claculated. Their Speed Stat is taken into account as well as other effects such as previous attack effects that my have raised or lowered speed, whether the Pokémon is Paralyzed and whether or not it is holding an item that lowers Speed such as the Power Items used to train EVs or an Iron ball.With these statistics now calculated, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attackBase Power = FLOOR((25 * TargetSpeed / UserSpeed) + 1)With this equation, it is very easy to see that if the user has a considerably lower speed, due to being a slow Pokémon or just being unlucky and having had loads of attacks that have lowered speed used on it as well as being Paralyzed and holding an Iron Ball, it will do considerable damage. However, even if the Base Power calculation obtains an amount that is greater than 150, you will never have more than that.

battleEffect: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.
secondaryEffect: Switches user's Attack & SP. ATT stat increases with opponent.

name: Power Trip
battleEffect: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user's stats are boosted, the greater the name's power.
secondaryEffect: Increases damage by 100% for each stage a stat has been increased by the user

name: Power Whip
battleEffect: The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the like to lash the target.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Present
battleEffect: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. The gift restores HP sometimes, however.
secondaryEffect:
This name has got four different possibilities for outcomes
40% - Base Power of 40
30% - Base Power of 80
20% - Heal 25% of target's max HP
10% - Base Power of 120.

name: Protect
battleEffect: This name enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
secondaryEffect: If used in succession with other protection names, its success rate is cut to 33% of what it was, working cumulatively the more it's used. This will prevent damage and effects of almost all possible attacks that would be inflicted upon the user.There are a few names and abilities which do break through this name The following names are also unaffected by Protect & Detect: Doom Desire (delayed damage only), Future Sight (delayed damage only), Feint, Hyperspace Fury, Hyperspace Hole, Imprison, Perish Song, Phantom Force, Psych Up, Shadow Force, Transform

name: Psybeam
battleEffect: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also confuse the target.
secondaryEffect: May induce Confusion

name: Psychic
battleEffect: The target is hit with a strong telekinetic force to inflict damage. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

name: Psychic Fangs
battleEffect: The user attacks by biting the target with its psychic capabilities. This name can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
secondaryEffect: This name will rename any Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil or that is in play on the opponent's team.

name: Psychic Terrain
battleEffect: This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority names and powers up Psychic-type names for five turns.
secondaryEffect: This name creates a terrain that helps Pokémon on the ground for 5 turns. It prevents all Pokémon on the ground from using attacks or being targeted by attacks with increased priority from opposing Pokémon, and boosts the power of Psychic-type names on grounded Pokémon by 30%

name: Psycho Cut
battleEffect: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Psyshock
battleEffect: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This name deals physical damage.
secondaryEffect: Inflicts physical damage

name: Quash
battleEffect: The user suppresses the target and makes its name go last.
secondaryEffect: Target Pokémon names last in the turn

name: Quick Attack
battleEffect: The user lunges at the target to inflict damage, moving at blinding speed. This name always goes first.
secondaryEffect: Has increased Speed Priority

name: Quick Guard
battleEffect: The user protects itself and its allies from priority names.
secondaryEffect: Unlike Protect, which works on all names, Quick Guard prevents all effects from names with a heightened Speed Priority. In addition to that, it also protects all the player's Pokémon on the field rather than just the user.However, even though it blocks all names with a Speed Priority of 1 or higher. In addition to that, the name Feint will hit through this name, as it does with Protect and Detect.

name: Rage Fist
battleEffect: The user converts its rage into energy to attack. The more times the user has been hit by attacks, the greater the name's power.
secondaryEffect: Increases base power by 50 based on how many times the user has been hit by damage from other Pokémon's attacks

name: Rage Powder
battleEffect: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opposing Pokémon aim only at the user.
secondaryEffect: Draws Attacks towards the user rather than ally

name: Rain Dance
battleEffect: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type attacks. The rain also lowers the power of Fire-type attacks.
secondaryEffect: Causes Rain for 5 turns.

name: Rapid Spin
battleEffect: The user performs a spin attack that can also eliminate the effects of such names as Bind, Wrap, and Leech Seed. This also boosts the user's Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: User renames trapping names. Increased Speed by 1 stage.

name: Razor Leaf
battleEffect: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at opposing Pokémon. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Recover
battleEffect: The user regenerates its cells, restoring its own HP by up to half its max HP.
secondaryEffect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

name: Reflect
battleEffect: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical names for five turns.
secondaryEffect: Halves Attack damage inflicted on the user's side of the field

name: Reflect Type
battleEffect: The user reflects the target's type to become the same type as the target.
secondaryEffect: Makes opponent's type match user

name: Rest
battleEffect: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user's HP and cures any status conditions.
secondaryEffect: User restores health, then sleeps.

name: Retaliate
battleEffect: The user takes revenge for a fainted ally. This name's power is boosted if an ally fainted in the previous turn.
secondaryEffect: If a team-mate has been knocked out in the turn before this Pokémon names, the power is increased by 100%.

name: Reversal
battleEffect: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.
secondaryEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is down.

name: Revival Blessing
battleEffect: The user bestows a loving blessing, reviving a party Pokémon that has fainted and restoring half that Pokémon's max HP.
secondaryEffect: Revives a fainted Pokémon up to 50% maximum Hit Points

name: Roar
battleEffect: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
secondaryEffect: Ends wild battles.

name: Rock Blast
battleEffect: The user attacks by hurling hard rocks at the target. This name hits two to five times in a row.
secondaryEffect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

name: Rock Polish
battleEffect: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This sharply boosts the user's Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Speed two stages.

name: Rock Slide
battleEffect: Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Rock Smash
battleEffect: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

name: Rock Throw
battleEffect: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to inflict damage.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Rock Tomb
battleEffect: The user hurls boulders at the target to inflict damage. This also lowers the target's Speed stat by cutting off its namement.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Speed one stage.

name: Rollout
battleEffect: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. This attack becomes more powerful each time it hits.
secondaryEffect: Uses the same name for 5 turns; name's power raises if it hits.

name: Roost
battleEffect: The user lands and rests its body. This name restores the user's HP by up to half its max HP.
secondaryEffect: Heals up to 50% of maximum Hit Points. Flying-type Pokémon are no longer Flying-type for the rest of the turn.

name: Round
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with a song. If others use this name, they will act immediately after the initial user, and the power of their Rounds will be boosted.
secondaryEffect: This name increases in power when used by different Pokémon on your side in a single turn. When Round is used by multiple Pokémon, the Pokémon will immediately use it, regardless of Speed or Priority. Each consecutive use of this name has the power doubled up until it hits the maximum of 240.

name: Ruination
battleEffect: The user summons a ruinous disaster. This cuts the target's HP in half.
secondaryEffect: Cuts the opponent's Hit Points by 50% of the current value

name: Sacred Sword
battleEffect: The user attacks by slicing with a sword. The target's stat changes don't affect the damage inflicted by this name.
secondaryEffect: Ignores stat changes

name: Safeguard
battleEffect: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.
secondaryEffect: Prevents all status conditions for five turns

name: Salt Cure
battleEffect: The user salt cures the target, inflicting damage every turn. Steel and Water types are more strongly affected by this name.
secondaryEffect: Inflicts damage on the target at the end of each turn. Doubles damage inflicted on Water or Steel-type opponents

name: Sand Attack
battleEffect: Sand is hurled in the target's face, lowering the target's accuracy.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Accuracy one stage.

name: Sand Tomb
battleEffect: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm that inflicts damage for four to five turns.
secondaryEffect: Traps opponent.

name: Sandstorm
battleEffect: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to damage all Pokémon except Rock, Ground, and Steel types. The sandstorm also boosts the Sp. Def stats of Rock types.
secondaryEffect: Causes a Sandstorm for 5 turns.

name: Scale Shot
battleEffect: The user attacks by shooting scales two to five times in a row. This name boosts the user's Speed stat but lowers its Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: Increases Speed by 1 stage. Lowers Defense by 1 Stage

name: Scary Face
battleEffect: The user frightens the target with a scary face to harshly lower its Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Speed two stages.

name: Scratch
battleEffect: Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Screech
battleEffect: An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target's Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Defense two stages.

name: Seed Bomb
battleEffect: The user attacks by slamming a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Seismic Toss
battleEffect: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user's level.
secondaryEffect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.

name: Self-Destruct
battleEffect: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this name.
secondaryEffect: User faints

name: Shadow Ball
battleEffect: The user attacks by hurling a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

name: Shadow Claw
battleEffect: The user attacks by slashing the target with a sharp claw made from shadows. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Shadow Punch
battleEffect: The user throws a punch from the shadows. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

name: Shadow Sneak
battleEffect: The user extends its shadow and attacks the target from behind. This name always goes first.
secondaryEffect: Has increased Speed Priority

name: Shed Tail
battleEffect: The user creates a substitute for itself using its own HP before switching places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
secondaryEffect: Creates a decoy using 1/4 of the user's maximum HP. Switches out to another Pokémon in the part with the Substitute still out

name: Sheer Cold
battleEffect: The target faints instantly. This name is less likely to hit the target if used by Pokémon other than Ice types.
secondaryEffect: This name has its accuracy lowered when used by non-Ice-type Pokémon;, and cannot damage Ice-type Pokémon

name: Shift Gear
battleEffect: The user rotates its gears, boosting its Attack stat and sharply boosting its Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack one stage. Raises user's Speed two stages.

name: Shock Wave
battleEffect: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

name: Silk Trap
battleEffect: The user spins a silken trap, protecting itself from damage while lowering the Speed stat of any attacker that makes direct contact.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack one stage if hit by physical contact. Fails on successive uses

name: Sing
battleEffect: A soothing lullaby is sung in a beautiful voice that puts the target to sleep.
secondaryEffect: Induces sleep.

name: Skill Swap
battleEffect: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.
secondaryEffect: This name will switch the users ability to the ability of the target Pokémon if that Pokémon does not have the Illusion, Wonder Guard, Stance Change, Multitype, RKS System, Zen Mode, Battle Bond, Comatores, Gulp Missile, DIsguise, Hunger Switch, Neutralizing Gas, Shields Down, Schooling, Power Construct, As One - Unnerve Chilling Neigh & As One - Unnerve Grim Neigh abilities

name: Skitter Smack
battleEffect: The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack one stage

name: Sky Attack
battleEffect: The user attacks the turn after using this name. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit and may also make the target flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Slack Off
battleEffect: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half its max HP.
secondaryEffect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

name: Slam
battleEffect: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Slash
battleEffect: The target is attacked with a slash of claws, scythes, or the like. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Sleep Talk
battleEffect: The user randomly uses one of the names it knows. This name can only be used while the user is asleep.
secondaryEffect: Uses an own random name while asleep.

name: Sludge
battleEffect: The user hurls unsanitary sludge at the target to inflict damage. This may also poison the target.
secondaryEffect: May induce poison.

name: Sludge Bomb
battleEffect: The user hurls unsanitary sludge at the target to inflict damage. This may also poison the target.
secondaryEffect: May induce poison.

name: Sludge Wave
battleEffect: The user strikes everything around it by swamping the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also poison those it hits.
secondaryEffect: May induce poison.

name: Smack Down
battleEffect: The user throws a stone or similar projectile to attack the target. If the target is in the air, it will be knocked down to the ground.
secondaryEffect: In addition to removing Ground-type immunities, this name can also affect Pokémon that have flown up into the air using Fly or Bounce. Doing so cancels the name. It can hit Pokémon using or affected by Sky Drop but doesn't cancel the name.

name: Smart Strike
battleEffect: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

name: Smog
battleEffect: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. This may also poison the target.
secondaryEffect: May induce poison.

name: Snarl
battleEffect: The user yells as if it's ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stats of opposing Pokémon.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

name: Snowscape
battleEffect: The user summons a snowstorm lasting five turns. This boosts the Defense stats of Ice types.
secondaryEffect: Causes Snowstorm for 5 rounds.

name: Soak
battleEffect: The user shoots a torrent of water that changes the target's type to Water.
secondaryEffect: Changes opponent's type to Water-type.

name: Solar Beam
battleEffect: The user gathers light on the first turn, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
secondaryEffect: Charges for the first turn, damages on the second. If Sunny Day is in effect, the charge and attack is in the same turn.

name: Solar Blade
battleEffect: The user gathers light on the first turn, then fills a blade with the light's energy and attacks on the next turn.
secondaryEffect: Charges for the first turn, damages on the second. If Sunny Day is in effect, the charge and attack is in the same turn.

name: Spark
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with an electrically charged tackle. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Speed Swap
battleEffect: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.
secondaryEffect: Switches Speed stat with target

name: Spicy Extract
battleEffect: The user emits an incredibly spicy extract, sharply boosting the target's Attack stat and harshly lowering the target's Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises the target's Attack stat by two stages. Lowers the target's Defense by two stages

name: Spikes
battleEffect: The user lays a trap of spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will damage opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
secondaryEffect: The damage that is given through Spikes is determined by the amount of layers that you place.

name: Spiky Shield
battleEffect: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this name also damages any attacker that makes direct contact.
secondaryEffect: Damages by 1/8th Maximum Hit Points if hit by physical contact.

name: Spin Out
battleEffect: The user spins furiously by straining its legs, inflicting damage on the target. This also harshly lowers the user's Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Speed two stages.

name: Spirit Break
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with so much force that it could break the target's spirit. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack one stage

name: Spit Up
battleEffect: The power stored using the name Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the name's power.
secondaryEffect: This name has four tiers of damage; 3 are stockpiled, 1 isn't. Unfortunately the one that isn't is that the attack doesn't do anything if you haven't stockpiled so you have to make sure to Stockpile first.If you use Spit Up after 1 Stockpile, the Base Power will be 100If you use Spit Up after 2 Stockpiles, the Base Power will be 200If you use Spit Up after 3 Stockpiles, the Base Power will be 300

name: Spite
battleEffect: The user unleashes its grudge on the name last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.
secondaryEffect: Opponent's last name loses 4 PP.

name: Splash
battleEffect: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Spore
battleEffect: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.
secondaryEffect: Induces sleep.

name: Stealth Rock
battleEffect: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team. The trap damages opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
secondaryEffect: Stealth Rock's damaging methods are rather unique. Instead of doing a set amount of damage for the amount of layers given, it instead is based on the opponent's type. The attack is a Rock Type attack so the damage is based upon the opponent's Weakness to it.

name: Steel Beam
battleEffect: The user fires a beam of steel that it collected from its entire body. This also damages the user.
secondaryEffect: User loses half their Maximum Hit Points. This effect is ignored by Magic Guard.

name: Steel Roller
battleEffect: The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This name fails if the ground hasn't turned into a terrain.
secondaryEffect: Destroys Terrains

name: Sticky Web
battleEffect: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stats upon switching into battle.
secondaryEffect: Sets a web that lower the opponent's Speed by one stage upon switching.

name: Stockpile
battleEffect: The user stores power and boosts its Defense and Sp. Def stats. This name can be used up to three times.
secondaryEffect: User stockpiles power for up to 3 turns. Raises Defense & Special Defense one stage until Stockpile is released.

name: Stomp
battleEffect: The user attacks by stomping on the target with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Stomping Tantrum
battleEffect: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. This name's power is doubled if the user's previous name failed.
secondaryEffect: Doubles damage if last name failed

name: Stone Edge
battleEffect: The user stabs the target with sharpened stones. This name has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.
secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

name: Stored Power
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user's stats are boosted, the greater the name's power.
secondaryEffect: This attack's power starts off with 20 Base Power but increases by 20 Base Power for each stat increase used by the Pokémon. Can get a maximum Base Power of 860. names with stat lowering effects do not affect this name's power.

name: Strength Sap
battleEffect: The user restores its own HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat. It then lowers the target's Attack stat.
secondaryEffect: Heals user of Hit Points equal to target's Attack stat. Lowers target's Attack by 1 stage

name: String Shot
battleEffect: The user blows silk from its mouth that binds opposing Pokémon and harshly lowers their Speed stats.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Speed two stages.

name: Struggle Bug
battleEffect: The user attacks by struggling against opposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Sp. Atk stats.
secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

name: Stuff Cheeks
battleEffect: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply boosts its Defense stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense two stages.

name: Stun Spore
battleEffect: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.
secondaryEffect: Induces Paralysis

name: Substitute
battleEffect: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of its own HP. The substitute serves as the user's decoy.
secondaryEffect: This name creates a Substitute on the field using 1/4 of its maximum Hit Points. This substitute will receive all damage from attacks until its Hit Points are depleted. There are several names that hit beyond the substitute.

name: Sucker Punch
battleEffect: This name enables the user to attack first. This name fails if the target is not readying an attack.
secondaryEffect: Damages the opponent only if they are intending to use a damaging name. Fails if used after the opponent names.

name: Sunny Day
battleEffect: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type attacks. The sunlight also lowers the power of Water-type attacks.
secondaryEffect: Causes Sunshine for 5 turns

name: Super Fang
battleEffect: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target's HP in half.
secondaryEffect: Cuts the opponent's Hit Points by 50% of the current value

name: Superpower
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with great power. This also lowers the user's Attack and Defense stats.
secondaryEffect: Lowers user's Attack and Defense one stage.

name: Supersonic
battleEffect: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.
secondaryEffect: Induces Confusion

name: Surf
battleEffect: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
secondaryEffect: May damage diving opponents

name: Swagger
battleEffect: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply boosts the target's Attack stat.
secondaryEffect: Induces Confusion. Raises opponent's Attack two stages.

name: Swallow
battleEffect: The power stored using the name Stockpile is absorbed by the user to restore its own HP. The more power is stored, the more HP is restored.
secondaryEffect: This name has four tiers of healing; 3 are stockpiled, 1 isn't. Unfortunately the one that isn't is that the attack doesn't do anything if you haven't stockpiled so you have to make sure to Stockpile first.If you use Swallow after 1 Stockpile, you will recover 1/4 of your Max HPIf you use Swallow after 2 Stockpiles, you will recover 1/2 of your Max HPIf you use Swallow after 3 Stockpiles, you will recover all of your Max HP

name: Sweet Kiss
battleEffect: The user kisses the target with a sweet, angelic cuteness that causes confusion.
secondaryEffect: Induces Confusion

name: Sweet Scent
battleEffect: The user releases a scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon's evasiveness.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Evasion two stages.

name: Swift
battleEffect: Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
secondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

name: Switcheroo
battleEffect: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.
secondaryEffect: Switches items with the opponent

name: Swords Dance
battleEffect: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply boosts the user's Attack stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack two stages.

name: Synthesis
battleEffect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
secondaryEffect: This name recovers its HP depending upon the weather. If no weather is in effect, it heals the user by 50% of their maximum Hit Points. If Sunny Day is in effect, this name heals the user by 66.66% of its maximum Hit Points and if Rain Dance, Hail or Sandstorm is in effect, this name heals the user by 25% of their maximum Hit Points

name: Tackle
battleEffect: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Tail Whip
battleEffect: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their Defense stats.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Defense one stage.

name: Tailwind
battleEffect: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that boosts the Speed stats of itself and its allies for four turns.
secondaryEffect: Increases Speed of all user's Pokémon for four turns by two stages.

name: Take Down
battleEffect: A reckless full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.
secondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

name: Taunt
battleEffect: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack names for three turns.
secondaryEffect: The opponent can only use damaging names for three turns

name: Tera Blast
battleEffect: If the user has Terastallized, it unleashes energy of its Tera Type. This name inflicts damage using the Attack or Sp. Atk statwhichever is higher for the user.
secondaryEffect: Changes type if the user is Terastallized. Damage inflicted depends on user's Attack or Special Attack. Highest stat used to determine if name is Physical or Special.

name: Terrain Pulse
battleEffect: The user utilizes the energy of the terrain to attack. This name's type and power change depending on the terrain at the time the name is used.
secondaryEffect: Becomes the type of Terrain and doubles in power

name: Thief
battleEffect: The user attacks and steals the target's held item simultaneously. The user can't steal anything if it already holds an item.
secondaryEffect: May steal opponent's item (temporarily in trainer battles).

name: Thrash
battleEffect: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
secondaryEffect: User uses the same Attack for 2-3 turns then becomes confused.

name: Throat Chop
battleEffect: The user attacks the target's throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using sound-based names for two turns.
secondaryEffect: Prevents target from using Sound names for 2 turns

name: Thunder
battleEffect: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: This name has different accuracies depending upon the weather. In Rain, it has an accuracy of 100%. In Sunshine, it has an accuracy of 50%. In all other weather states, it has an accuracy of 70%.

name: Thunder Fang
battleEffect: The user bites with electrified fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May PARALYZE opponent or cause opponent to flinch.

name: Thunder Punch
battleEffect: The target is attacked with an electrified punch. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Thunder Shock
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with a jolt of electricity. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Thunder Wave
battleEffect: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.
secondaryEffect: Induces Paralysis

name: Thunderbolt
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with a strong electric blast. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Tickle
battleEffect: The user tickles the target into laughing, lowering its Attack and Defense stats.
secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack and Defense one stage.

name: Tidy Up
battleEffect: The user tidies up and renames the effects of Spikes, Stealth Rock, Sticky Web, Toxic Spikes, and Substitute. This also boosts the user's Attack and Speed stats.
secondaryEffect: User renames trapping names. Increased Attack and Speed by 1 stage.

name: Torch Song
battleEffect: The user blows out raging flames as if singing a song, scorching the target. This also boosts the user's Sp. Atk stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Special Attack one stage

name: Torment
battleEffect: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same name twice in a row.
secondaryEffect: Opponent cannot use the same name in a row.

name: Toxic
battleEffect: A name that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
secondaryEffect: Induces severe poison.

name: Toxic Spikes
battleEffect: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
secondaryEffect:
Toxic Spikes is the only Entry Hazard attack that does not afflict damage on the Pokémon straight away. Instead, it inflicts them with the Poison Condition. It does not affect Pokémon of the Flying Type, Steel Type, Poison Type or Pokémon with the Levitate Ability
The damage that is given through Spikes is determined by the amount of layers that you place.

name: Trailblaze
battleEffect: The user attacks suddenly as if leaping out from tall grass. The user's nimble footwork boosts its Speed stat.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Speed one stage.

name: Tri Attack
battleEffect: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. This may also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
secondaryEffect: May induce burn, freeze or paralysis.

name: Trick
battleEffect: The user catches the target off guard and swaps the target's held item with its own.
secondaryEffect: Switches items with the opponent

name: Trick Room
battleEffect: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to name first for five turns.
secondaryEffect: Inverts the turn order in each Speed Priority bracked for 5 turns.

name: Triple Dive
battleEffect: The user performs a perfectly timed triple dive, hitting the target with splashes of water three times in a row.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Twin Beam
battleEffect: The user shoots mystical beams from its eyes to inflict damage. The target is hit twice in a row.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Uproar
battleEffect: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
secondaryEffect: Hits for 3 turns. No Pokémon can be Asleep during that time.

name: U-turn
battleEffect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
secondaryEffect: Pokémon switches out from battle

name: Venoshock
battleEffect: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This name's power is doubled if the target is poisoned.
secondaryEffect: Doubles damage inflicted if target is Poisoned

name: Vise Grip
battleEffect: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Volt Switch
battleEffect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
secondaryEffect: Pokémon switches out from battle

name: Water Gun
battleEffect: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Water Pledge
battleEffect: A column of water hits the target. When used with its fire counterpart, this name's power is boosted and a rainbow appears.
secondaryEffect:
This name, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Fire Pledge, will create a rainbow which doubles the changes of names having Seconday Effects for four turns. The power is increased to 150
This name, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Grass Pledge, will create a marsh which reduces the speed of all opponents by 75% for four turns.  The power is increased to 150

name: Water Pulse
battleEffect: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.
secondaryEffect: May induce Confusion

name: Waterfall
battleEffect: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

name: Wave Crash
battleEffect: The user shrouds itself in water and slams into the target with its whole body to inflict damage. This also damages the user quite a lot.
secondaryEffect: User receives 1/3rd of damage in re-coil.

name: Weather Ball
battleEffect: This name's type and power change depending on the weather at the time the name is used.
secondaryEffect: This name changes type based on the weather. In Sun it's Fire-type, in Rain it's Water-type, in Hail it's Ice-type and in Sandstorms it's Rock-type. When Dynamaxed, the Max name also changes type accordingly so in Sun it summons Max Flare, Rain it is Max Geyser, Snow it's Max Hailstorm and Sandstorm it's Max Rockfall.

name: Whirlpool
battleEffect: The user traps the target inside a violent, swirling whirlpool that inflicts damage for four to five turns.
secondaryEffect: Traps the opponent for 4 to 5 turns

name: Whirlwind
battleEffect: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
secondaryEffect: Ends wild battles.

name: Wide Guard
battleEffect: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
secondaryEffect: Wide Guard protects against specific names, specifically names which have more than one target such as Surf & Earthquake. In addition to protecting the user, it protects all of the user's allies in battle for that turn.This effect doesn't just correspond to names used by the opponent, but it also protects allies from damage from names by other allies which would inadvertantly damage them, such as Surf which hits all neighbouring Pokémon.There are a few names however, that it doesn't protect against; Clear Smog, Haze & Perish Song

name: Wild Charge
battleEffect: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into the target. This also damages the user a little.
secondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

name: Will-O-Wisp
battleEffect: The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.
secondaryEffect: Induces burn.

name: Wing Attack
battleEffect: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Wish
battleEffect: One turn after this name is used, the user's or its replacement's HP is restored by up to half the user's max HP.
secondaryEffect: In 1 turn, it heals whatever Pokémon is in this position on the field's Hit Points by 50% of the maximum Hit Points.

name: Work Up
battleEffect: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats are boosted.
secondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack & Special Attack one stage.

name: Worry Seed
battleEffect: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target's Ability Insomnia.
secondaryEffect: Changes the opponent's ability to Insomnia

name: Wrap
battleEffect: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
secondaryEffect: Traps opponent.

name: X-Scissor
battleEffect: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes, claws, or the like as if they were a pair of scissors.
secondaryEffect: No effect.

name: Yawn
battleEffect: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
secondaryEffect: Target falls asleep during the next turn.

name: Zap Cannon
battleEffect: The user attacks by firing an electric blast like a cannon. This also leaves the target with paralysis.
secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

name: Zen Headbutt
battleEffect: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.
secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.
